title: What do Harappans import and export? - Quora

response.answer_text: The Harappan civilization died out over 3,500 years ago, so, no importing or exporting going on lately for them! The area of present day Pakistan is where the Harappan’s lived. There is also an archeological site in Pakistan today called Harappa. So, assuming you are interested in US trade with Pakistan, here is Pakistan’s imports from and exports to the US. Pakistan imported $2.1 billion worth of goods in 2016 from the US. Major categories included machinery, aircraft, cotton, iron and steel and agricultural products. In 2016, Pakistan exported to the US, $3.4 billion in goods. Major categories included textiles, apparel, leather products and cotton. Pakistan enjoyed a $1.3 billion trade surplus with the US in 2016. More details on US-Pakistan trade can be found here: United States Trade Representative
Harappans export widgets and import gadgets .
